messages.message:
Is anyone else seing CIs (https://jenkins.instabase.com/job/instabase/job/PR-70525/1/console) fail due to Redis? Why are we even using redis in a unit test?
```[2025-05-09T00:54:55.969Z] Traceback (most recent call last):
[2025-05-09T00:54:55.969Z]   File "/home/jenkins/pyenv/versions/3.9.17/lib/python3.9/site-packages/tenacity/__init__.py", line 412, in call
[2025-05-09T00:54:55.969Z]     result = fn(*args, **kwargs)
[2025-05-09T00:54:55.969Z]   File "/instabase_dir/shared-utils/py-utils/flow/server/build/test/py/instabase/cache/stats/stats_collector.py", line 178, in stats_wrapper
[2025-05-09T00:54:55.969Z]     return func(client, *args, **kwargs)
[2025-05-09T00:54:55.970Z]   File "/instabase_dir/shared-utils/py-utils/flow/server/build/test/py/instabase/cache/cache.py", line 186, in delete
[2025-05-09T00:54:55.970Z]     return self._get_client().delete(*fixed_keys)
[2025-05-09T00:54:55.970Z]   File "/home/jenkins/pyenv/versions/3.9.17/lib/python3.9/site-packages/redis/client.py", line 1293, in delete
[2025-05-09T00:54:55.970Z]     return self.execute_command('DEL', *names)
[2025-05-09T00:54:55.970Z]   File "/home/jenkins/pyenv/versions/3.9.17/lib/python3.9/site-packages/redis/client.py", line 836, in execute_command
[2025-05-09T00:54:55.970Z]     conn = self.connection or pool.get_connection(command_name, **options)
[2025-05-09T00:54:55.970Z]   File "/home/jenkins/pyenv/versions/3.9.17/lib/python3.9/site-packages/redis/connection.py", line 1073, in get_connection
[2025-05-09T00:54:55.970Z]     connection.connect()
[2025-05-09T00:54:55.970Z]   File "/home/jenkins/pyenv/versions/3.9.17/lib/python3.9/site-packages/redis/connection.py", line 544, in connect
[2025-05-09T00:54:55.970Z]     raise ConnectionError(self._error_message(e))
[2025-05-09T00:54:55.970Z] redis.exceptions.ConnectionError: Error 111 connecting to 127.0.0.1:41693. Connection refused.```
Probably the same reasons we use live deployments of almost every DB type in our CI tests :sob: lol
